New Records: Bradley Barcola scored the fastest ever goal by a France player, beating the previous quickest of 38 seconds by Bernard Lacombe, also against Italy at the 1978 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Italy equalized via a magnificent goal on the half-hour mark, as Dimarco volleyed high into the far corner of the net.
Frattesi scored the winning goal for Italy, intercepting a pass and bursting into the box to score from Retegui's center.
Raspadori scored the third goal for Italy, collecting a pass from Udogie and tucking it in.
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Kylian Mbappé struggled to make an impact in Paris.
Deschamps handed a debut on the right wing to Michael Olise, the London-born Bayern Munich winger who starred in the France side that won the Olympic silver medal last month.
Post-Match Reflections: Spalletti said, 'Conceding a goal after 13 seconds could have driven us crazy but we were very good in the way we reacted. We kept our focus and did some great things beyond the goals. We were giants tonight.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Italy will face Israel next on Monday, with that match taking place in Budapest due to the security situation in the Middle East.
France, for whom captain Kylian Mbappé struggled to make an impact in Paris, will hope to bounce back from a flat performance when they take on Belgium next in Lyon.
